website_summaries.verdict: A convenient way to provide your spiky insectivore with the bug-based protein it craves, a jar of Fluker’s crickets will last you a while, and it beats raising your own food-crickets by miles.
pros: Crickets are gut-loaded with extra calcium
Freeze-drying process seals in essential nutrients
cons: The smell of freeze-dried crickets isn’t the most pleasant, but hedgehogs don’t seem to mind

customer_reviews.title: Turns out I have a beautiful bright green gecko that's more than a foot long ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this for some little frogs we were trying to keep as pets. They were way too big for the three tiny trio. I decided to return the item. The company refunded my money but didn't require me to return the product. I almost threw it away but.. about 6 months later I redid my flower garden and noticed some really big lizards so i put some in the garden. Turns out I have a beautiful bright green gecko that's more than a foot long living in my tree who is now coming for food daily. Adorable :)
customer_reviews.author: kiwiolive

customer_reviews.title: My dragon refuses these
customer_reviews.text: I can't really say for quality, because my little dragon straight out refuses to eat them. I even made little cricket burritos (warapped them in collard greens) and I kidyou not, this punk would smell it, grab the burrito, shake his head furriously like a dog, and throw the cricket out. He did this with all of them, so now these poor crickets are scattered about the cage. Uhg. So I guess they don't smell good to him, but he'll eat live ones. Ultimately I think it depends on your pet, but these were a no-go for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Maddalena

customer_reviews.title: They are near impossible to get rid of and like to burrow under my dragons belly
customer_reviews.text: This items contains small beetle type bugs that get into you habitat and reproduce! They are near impossible to get rid of and like to burrow under my dragons belly. The product itself she likes fine but the bugs that come along with it are a expensive to fix problem! BUY LIVE!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Howard

customer_reviews.title: Several concerns with these
customer_reviews.text: When I peeled off the cover it had a smashed bug piece and a huge feeler attached underneath which pulled out from inside the jar which was a red flag. The smell was off as well. The first third of the container was covered in a white chalky powder and the overall bottle is filled with odd looking bits and crushed pieces and that same powder. I will not be feeding this to any of my pets. From now on I will purchase locally so I can see the quality and what is in the container beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if they are delicious enough to recommend..
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to review freeze dried crickets. The container is the size of a spice jar and it is filled to the top. The crickets are still whole for the most part. Not sure if they are delicious enough to recommend . . . I am not that brave. The seller shipped immediately and I received the item on time and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Espana

customer_reviews.title: recommended by 4 out of 5 bearded dragon dentists
customer_reviews.text: Our bearded is willing to eat these. We feed them along with blueberries as otherwise we found they dried him out and backed him up. Bearded dragons get their fluids from food and these are very dry. But he does like them and eats them which is a success for our picky eater. Now just to figure out how to get him to eat his greens and we will be all set.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My lizard gave me the stink eye
customer_reviews.text: My fussy eater Beardies turns his nose up at these. He gives me the lizard look If offer these. In his book it’s not a tasty treat but some kind of offense. The quality seems ok, lots of broken bits. These crickets are to large for a baby or juvenile and need breaking up to meet the space between eyes rule on size for feeding. I must continue my search for something acceptable to him in case of live food being unavailable emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.R.

customer_reviews.title: My fish didn't like these crickets.
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy these at Wal-Mart. They are the same brand, but different packaging. My Oscars love the Wal-Mart version as treats, and will literally jump out of the water to get to them. This container was at least 1/3 full of just pieces and dust, and my Oscars won't touch them. I have to scoop them up and throw them out. I won't buy these again, will stick with the white label from Wal-Mart.
customer_reviews.author: Nuktek (Mike Houston)

customer_reviews.title: i highly recommend this product to everyone that own reptiles
customer_reviews.text: what i like about this product is that you guys have everything with pet stuff. Its so hard to find freeze dried crickets for reptiles and im glad that you guys had this product. i was looking all over for this product at the petsore and they didnt even have it at petco. I am very happy to have it. my 4 leopard geckos will be very happy to eat these :-)
customer_reviews.author: christa wiswesser

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product and purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have a bearded dragon and she actually has begun to favor these over live crickets. She is 3 years old and healthy and has been eating Flukers Crickets and Grasshoppers all of her life. The closest pet store to me is 12 miles away, not horrible but it is certainly more convenient and comparably priced to get them from Amazon. I am happy with everything about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Taste great!
customer_reviews.text: The cheapest I can find them now. I had a half a jar for breakfast already. Then I read the label... "Pet food". Uh oh. Just kidding. I use these for bait for my cane pole and fly rod. Soak then about an hour before you go fishing so they stay on the hook better. Also, I put a tiny bit of garlic powder in the water (about 1/2 a shot glass of warm water for a about a dozen crickets). Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ground up like dust.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several of these with no problems, my bird loves them. But about a third the way through one jar from the bottom there was almost all cricket dust, ground up like dust..not even legs. He wouldn't eat them anyway. Not sure if one can tell by the photo. But whole crickets on top and fine (like) power with a few legs the rest of the way. I guess I could make cricket cakes. Thus the only 4 stars, otherwise great and will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Chickens loved them! My wallet, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: My chickens loved these! Even the most skiddish ones would let me hand feed them because it was worth the "risk" apparently. About 1/4 of the container was just dust of pulverized crickets so that kind of stunk. Plus you don't get a lot for the money to begin with. Especially in comparison to mealworms. Would by them again if I had chicken that wasn't eating because these almost surely would break that cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Utkevdawg

customer_reviews.title: The old gecko knows good food.
customer_reviews.text: My very old gecko loves these to supliment his live crickets. He is 17 years old. He knows good food.
customer_reviews.author: happyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for your beardie, but lots of cricket legs and bits.
customer_reviews.text: I offer these moistened with some water to my beardie daily. He really likes them! There isn’t much of a smell, which is a plus. However, a lot of the container consists of crickets legs and other little bits— I recommend you pour the whole thing out and them pick out the whole pieces to keep and throw away the rest. It makes it easier instead of picking through all the little bits every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Enjoys These
customer_reviews.text: All of my critters and carnivorous plants enjoy these, for the animals they immediately smell the presence of these crickets when placed in their enclosures so they're doing their job just fine! Not only that, but they'll last a very long time at room temperature and I love that!
customer_reviews.author: Kia L.

customer_reviews.title: Tasty!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not certain of that as I have not eaten any myself but my giant bearded dragon loves them. He'll eat as many as I give to him - and fast. I do have a smaller bearded dragon that doesn't even attempt to eat them but she doesn't eat much of anything anyway. It's a great filler for when I run out of crickets and can't make it to the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: S. Platt

customer_reviews.title: I subscribe to these
customer_reviews.text: To supplement my bearded dragon and broad headed skink's diet. I have to cut them in half as my dragon is still under a year (8 mon.). They keep much better than the canned crickets (which I also subscribe to as the skink likes them) so I have to order them less often.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: My “grand dragon” loves these
customer_reviews.text: Finally got our juvenile beardy on a nice balance diet of kale, carrots, pellets and these chopped up crickets. I followed another reviewers suggestion and spray food down for added hydration. Before these, all she would it was fresh crickets. Now she’s forced to eat through her salads and is really growing fast!
customer_reviews.author: Sassenach

customer_reviews.title: Great temporary alternative to live.
customer_reviews.text: I love these even though I gave 4 stars on flavor and presentation, I mean they ARE dead and freeze dried. I use these for my tegu but have also managed to get a leopard gecko to eat them from tongs (I would rehydrate them when doing this).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved by my bushbaby!!
customer_reviews.text: The best freeze-dried crickets on the market!! These are gut-loaded and offer more vitamins than just regular crickets. These are quite large and they don’t stink! My bushbaby LOVES them. I just wish I could get them in larger quantities in one bottle.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mara

customer_reviews.title: Good if your dragon will eat them
customer_reviews.text: Every bearded dragon is different and ours really didn’t want to eat the dried crickets (we found that he likes the canned ones much better). If your dragon likes feeeze dried ones then this is a good one to get. Seemed like most of them were intact compared to the other brand we got.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for my turtle
customer_reviews.text: My western painted turtle absolutely loved these. I first bought him live crickets, but I decided to give these a try. As soon as he spotted them he sped off towards them. They were a success and I'll continue to order these for him.
customer_reviews.author: Hecbec15

customer_reviews.title: Fish go crazy good value mostly whole crickets
customer_reviews.text: While I have never tried them i can tell you that all my tanks get these and the goes crazy once they hit the water. Especially my Oscars and Severums so I would say they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Thompson

customer_reviews.title: My bearded dragon loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon loves these, and she is very picky! She eats then as good as she eats the live crickets. These are great for when you don't have a pet store near. There are plenty in the container for the price. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Rissa p

customer_reviews.title: My turtle loves 'em
customer_reviews.text: My turtle loves 'em. They're great for some variety in feeding. (I had an order of them that smelled really wrong, once; Amazon was great about refund/replace. I've not had any problems since and it's been well over a year since.)
customer_reviews.author: crochet4ever

customer_reviews.title: Good size, I needed live.
customer_reviews.text: My aquarium fish nor my pet birds would eat them. I have different kinds of birds but it was a no go. I do not like crickets 🦗 so freeze-dried seemed a great alternative. However they were good size. I did try to soak them for the birds. Maybe if they were smaller.
customer_reviews.author: amy mccombs

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: My box turtle loves these. It’s great to have freeze dried bugs if I can’t get to the store for meal worms. Just soak water for a few minutes before serving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were a great price
customer_reviews.text: The bottle looks fine but our frog won't eat them. Realizing he only eats the live ones and that this is pretty common so I don't necessarily feel it was the product quality, more the fact that the just didn't move
customer_reviews.author: E.Jones

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a while, full of protein, and beardie loves them
customer_reviews.text: We combine these with veggies and live crickets and our beardie gained a healthy amount of weight and has a lot of energy! He likes this brand of freeze dried crickets so much that we need to stop feeding him sometimes or else he will over eat. We've gone through a few bottles and each lasts about a month with daily feeding. Can't say we would only feed him these but they seem to keep him healthy and are a good addition to his diet when combined with plenty of fresh food.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Our Sugar Gliders Love Them
customer_reviews.text: Exact same crickets I buy at the pet store but half the price. We use them as a reward treat to get them to come to us and sit in our hand. There is a difference in crickets. Found a bulk bag from another manufacturer at Tractor supply and our sugar gliders would not eat them at all.
customer_reviews.author: William Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Purched for emergencies, happy they worked.
customer_reviews.text: Great for emergencies. I live in Alaska where live critter food isn't always available. My vailed chameleon has been eating these for 3 days now while both the pet shop and I are waiting on live deliveried. He didn't give them a second look when he had live food to eat but munches them down now when hungry and appears to be enjoying the crunch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My hedgehog hates them but my boyfriend thinks they’re delicious. I don’t tongue kiss him anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Inkyneedle

customer_reviews.title: Cockroach in the crickets.
customer_reviews.text: Great value however there is a HUGE cockroach in the container and my daughter is highly allergic to them. She sticks her hand in there to feed her dragon. I was lucky to catch it before she did. Now she can’t feed her own pet. Disregard the calcium. It dumped fast ha.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgit

customer_reviews.title: Daily "Main Course" for my turtle!
customer_reviews.text: The two pack is a convenient way to buy the Fluker's 1.2-Ounce Freeze Dried Crickets and save a little money!. These crickets have become the main food for our large common musk turtle, 'Floyd,' along with the Flukers River shrimp. We buy live feeding fish every other month or so, yet our turtle will often forgo them for his crickets & shrimp - which he'll take right off my fingertips! He must love the taste and crunch - his actions speak for themselves. We've had our turtle for many years (10 as of this review) and he has remained healthy, vibrant and active.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: My Oscar fish can’t wait.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the crickets and grasshoppers and my Oscar fish loves them both. When he sees me pickup the container he goes crazy with anticipation.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the quality. Very cheap quality. Spilled half the bottle and can say they jam them so tight and mostly broken and even baby crickets were in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Boutwell

customer_reviews.title: Loved by my bearded dragon.
customer_reviews.text: My beaded dragon loves these! He's a bit of a picky eater too but when I show him the bottle he jumps up and gets very excited. I originally got these for him as a back up food for winter because of the freaky weather my area has and I wasn't sure if my beardie would want to eat at all so I didn't waste money on live food that would die.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S

customer_reviews.title: No more crickets hopping all over the house!!
customer_reviews.text: My Turtle approves and I do too because I hated giving him live ones. One or two would always esacape from the tank somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Tiarah

customer_reviews.title: Caligula loves them
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon prefers these to live crickets so that makes my life easier. They also contain the calcium they need so that is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: LauraSunshine

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: I hate having to buy live crickets all the time and this is amazing. my son's Beardie (which is mine now, I guess) LOVES them and has gained some weight too. definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my Oscar fish loves these. The only issue is with the debris and leaves in the tank. But if you don’t want to worry about crickets jumping out of your aquarium this is a must buy
customer_reviews.author: ND4LIFE

customer_reviews.title: Backup food supply for gecko
customer_reviews.text: Gave flavor a 5 because gecko likes them. Cheaper than petsmart. Great to have if you run out of live crickets.
customer_reviews.author: Stan K.

customer_reviews.title: Geckos didn’t touch it
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money unfortunately. Our geckos don’t even acknowledge it after licking it once. Obviously doesn’t taste good.
customer_reviews.author: billk

customer_reviews.title: My crested dragon loves these crickets.
customer_reviews.text: My crested dragon loves these crickets. She sees me open the bottle and is running to grab one. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good for carnivorous plants and bearded dragons
customer_reviews.text: My carnivorous plants seemed to enjoy these, as does my beardie. The bits on my spatulata quickly molded, but at no detriment to the plant and I doubt the spores came from the crickets themselves.
customer_reviews.author: William Lemens

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: My squirrel loves these! He is picky abt crickets, but he loves these added to his lunch plate. They are crunchy, well dried, and don't have an overpowering smell like some he won't eat. Plus, they are gut-loaded with calcium- a huge plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Geckos loved them
customer_reviews.text: My leopard geckos have been finicky eaters, but they gobbled these right up, saving me from having to buy live crickets all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Sugar gliders love it!
customer_reviews.text: I feed this to my sugar gliders as a treat and they go crazy for it. I like it because it's a natural product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Bee

customer_reviews.title: Good food, about 1/3 of the bottle is just scraps
customer_reviews.text: Happy I don't have to feed my bearded dragon live crickets anymore. But be aware that only about 2/3 of the bottle is filled with crickets that my bearded dragon will eat. The rest is legs and scraps that he will not eat.
customer_reviews.author: dabullitt

customer_reviews.title: Turtle Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: I feed these to my aquatic turtle to give her calcium. She seems to love them which makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: DLHEAT

customer_reviews.title: Rejected by the little guy
customer_reviews.text: My hedgehog will pull every other dried insect out of his treat bowl and leave these behind. I have not personally taste-tested the crickets so I am basing this review solely on his rejection of them.
customer_reviews.author: Merideth Ekwall

customer_reviews.title: Good for extra cricket needs
customer_reviews.text: Can’t comment on the flavor but my male beardie loves crickets so I got these to mix with his other food so he’ll have extra crickets. He loves them so much that he sleeps in them
customer_reviews.author: Siva

customer_reviews.title: Nom nom nom
customer_reviews.text: Dude my beardie actually loves these and his favorite thing in the world is to chase and slaughter live insects so that's saying a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Gecko did not approve
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my leopard gecko had no interest in these. I wiggled them around to simulate movement, but after a quick bite, he retreated.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fought

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Not a terrible smell. Not sure how my frog likes it yet since he’s small and they have to be crushed up for him. I’m assuming he likes it? Lol overall good product
customer_reviews.author: Holly E.

customer_reviews.title: For More Than Jusr Dragons!
customer_reviews.text: Great little snacks for bearded dragon & pet duck! For Dragon: break apart & mist with water first, then toss into veggies. For Duck: drop them into pond/water bowl among shredded greens.
customer_reviews.author: jessika

customer_reviews.title: My dragon loves these so much. My other dragon ...
customer_reviews.text: My dragon loves these so much. My other dragon isn't a fan but my female practically inhales them when I give them to her as treats. She eats plenty of crickets on a regular basis too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My turtle loves it. The 3 bottles are about as much as a single bottle locally.
customer_reviews.author: oldIT

customer_reviews.title: Great to use when you don’t have live crickets
customer_reviews.text: Are use these crickets for my bearded gecko am I savanna monitor they tolerate them well
customer_reviews.author: mowgli39

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great - Now HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these for years for my insectivore birds. They were always great, consistent and my birds thrived on them. The last six containers I bought smelled horrendous --- like dog poop. Birds will not go near them. You do not want to buy these until the problem is resolved. They are disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: mjf

customer_reviews.title: Crickets
customer_reviews.text: My lizards were not fans of these and kind of just ignore them. These are a good size and come in whole pieces
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Love the quantity for the price. We will be buying again. Way better prices than the pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Orban

customer_reviews.title: My critters love this!
customer_reviews.text: I use as a food supplement for my wildlife rehab. They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: BOX TURTLE & WATER TURTLE APPROVED!
customer_reviews.text: Both of water turtle and our two box turtles love these dried crickets.. the crickets are large and plump for being dried. it's a treat we give our turtles and as soon as those dried crickets are put into their food bowls or dropped into the aquarium our turtles know it's treat time!!! Great product.. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Jarmusch

customer_reviews.title: LARGE to X-LARGE Crickets
customer_reviews.text: These are huge crickets! The seal was loose when they arrived, but they are exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great
customer_reviews.text: They taste great....lol...at least it seems so since my Gekkos love them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for when you can’t get to the store for live ones.
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon will eat these... but still prefers the live. Great for when you can’t get to the store for live ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great snack for possum babies.
customer_reviews.text: I learned recently that baby possums need a good deal of calcium, and these seemed to be a nice treat for the ones I cared for. They kinda stank, but the little guys LOVED them. :)
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: Item had no safety seal, also when I picked ...
customer_reviews.text: Item had no safety seal, also when I picked up the package it was opened and spilled out all over the box. I had to throw the whole thing into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: A reader!

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my carnivorous plants. Creepy as the crickets lose their legs and the “dust” gets everywhere!!! But it keeps my plants fed
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love the price and my bearded dragon loves them....will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sferrazza

customer_reviews.title: My Sugar Gliders love these. Added calcium is a plus
customer_reviews.text: My Sugar Gliders love these. Added calcium is a plus. Only wish there were some way to guage the general average amount of extra calcium I'm feeding my little fur babies. Just to assure I keep them on a balanced diet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the purpose, but my Beardie is picky. Rarely eats these, but at least it'll last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: IrelandRed

customer_reviews.title: Decent snack
customer_reviews.text: My beardies enjoyed these but only a few at a time and not all the time, maybe once a week they’d eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't taste so good but my hedghog sure likes them.
customer_reviews.author: someone like you

customer_reviews.title: Quality crickets
customer_reviews.text: Great price and though I would rather do fresh for my dragon, these last longer and provided the protein.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: For the hedgehog
customer_reviews.text: Came fast! Bought for my hedgehog. She seems to like them well enough.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ziraphale

customer_reviews.title: My bearded dragon loves them
customer_reviews.text: I have a bearded dragon, and he alsolutley loves these. The second I took the bottle out, he was right there either trying to climb out of his cage or (when I would let him run around my house), be right underneath me in a few seconds wanting them. It was a very good purchase and I'm happy he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Evangelyna Henson

customer_reviews.title: I like them, my dragon is very hesitent
customer_reviews.text: I like them, my dragon is very hesitent. BUT I keep them as a back up if I dont order live bugs in time. They are whole bugs.
customer_reviews.author: ShannonC

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative food source
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my RBP’s as another food supplementI have t caught them eating yet but they seem to be disappearing!!
customer_reviews.author: LillianAspen

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Good deal. Fiah love them but do not feed more then once a week turn water milky
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Is exactly what it is
customer_reviews.text: My dragon will eat them but doesn’t seem to like them, I only feed them to her if I ran out of her regular food
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Great buy highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect my one year old beardie loves them and she is picky ! Will definitely be getting again . So happy!!
customer_reviews.author: alexis smothers

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: my bearded dragon loved them. will definitely buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Two tail feathers up!
customer_reviews.text: My peacock love these. It would be great if they offered bulk packages because they are a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Ruiner6

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My lizard said they tasted good but would prefer fewer legs.
customer_reviews.author: M K.

customer_reviews.title: Hedgie approved
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I don't know about the taste or scent, personally, but my hedgehog loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our bearded dragon was a rescue and needed fed more often than normal. These were convenient and stress free. No escapees. The only thing I would have to say I disliked, was that the legs all fell off and the lizard wouldn't eat them so it left a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Turtle tested, Eartle approved!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, I have a box turtle and she has a mainly protein based diet. I can't house crickets, and I doubt she could catch them live anyway. Seem fresh and the bugs themselves are mostly whole. She gobbles them up like candy
customer_reviews.author: Aly Sunyear

customer_reviews.title: My Mississippi Map Loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I get these on a regular basis. My Map Turtle loves them!
customer_reviews.author: media

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T WORK FOR ME...
customer_reviews.text: MY CREATURES DID NOT TAKE TO THIS, WOULD NOT EAT IT, THEREFORE IT IS NOT ON MY BUY LIST ANYMORE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My bearded dragon love it.
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon love it...I do too. Easy to rehidrate...lizard doesn't have to chase the crickets...don't have to feed them or worry about them getting out!!
customer_reviews.author: jajh54

customer_reviews.title: Flukers Freeze Dried Crickets
customer_reviews.text: my dragon loves these.. nice size crickets... great price.. pet stores charge almost double for the same size
customer_reviews.author: Gloria F.

customer_reviews.title: dried crickets
customer_reviews.text: some of the crickets were to big for my bearded dragon to eat but i just cut them into smaller bites for him but other then that he loved them
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Hintz

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and money!
customer_reviews.text: Flavor?! Not sure, but our critters eat this stuff up like candy and saves dad from running out every week to buy live ones. We feed a tree frog and bearded dragon with them.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Seem like a good product
customer_reviews.text: It is what its described as being. My Bearded Dragon won't touch them though.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Great Crickets
customer_reviews.text: Great price compared to other pet stores, and this is the only type of crickets that my leopard geckos will eat. There are a lot of missing limbs floating around in the containers, but my geckos don’t really mind.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.text: Turtles don't care much for the legs but they always seem to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect filler to add for extra protein to beardie diet.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

product_meta.title: Fluker's Freeze-Dried Crickets
product_meta.description: Size:1.6 OunceFreeze Dried Crickets offer the natural nutrition many pets require. The freeze dried insects are an ideal choice for those that don't like to handle live prey. Great for reptiles, frogs, birds, tropical fish, sugar gliders, and hedgehogs!
feature_bullets: Great for reptiles, Tropical fish, birds, hedgehogs and sugar gliders
Included Components: Fluker'S 1.2-Ounce Freeze Dried Crickets
